article.title: Man's Aggression
article.author: Montagu, M.F.A.
article.text: The purpose of this book is to inquire into the validity of the views on human nature expressed in the widely read and influential books of Robert Ardrey and Konrad Lorenz. Ardrey's books are African Genesis (Atheneum, 1961), and The Territorial Imperative (Atheneum, 1966). Lorenz's book is On Aggression (Harcourt, Brace and World, 1966). In these books the authors argue that man is by instinct an aggressive creature, and it is this innate propensity to violence that accounts for individual and group aggression in man.
